thread.title: UCL. Arsenal hosted a goal show featuring group leaders Mbappe and Vitinha
thread.title_full: UCL. Arsenal hosted a goal show featuring group leaders Mbappe and Vitinha

author: Zamin.uz
title: UCL. Arsenal hosted a goal show featuring group leaders Mbappe and Vitinha
text:
The 5th round of the UEFA Champions League was held at an extremely high pace, providing fans with a series of impressive goals and unexpected results. In the central match of the round, Arsenal secured a convincing 3-1 victory over Bayern Munich at home, becoming the absolute leader of the group. Arteta's players haven't lost a single point so far - this once again confirms the team's excellent form.
Arsenal - Bayern Munich 3:1
Goals: Timber (22), Madueke (69), Martinelli (76) - Karl (32).
Arsenal: Raya, Lewis-Squally (Calafiori, 68'), Mosquera, Timber (White, 80'), Saliba, Subimendi, Rice, Merino, Eze (Edegaard, 80'), Trossard (Madoueke, 38'), Saka (Martinelli, 68').
Bayern Munich: Neuer, Ta, Stanisić, Upamecano (Kim, 81), Laimer (Bishof, 72), Kimmich (Goretzka, 81), Pavlovic, Olise, Gnabry (Jackson, 72), Karl (Guerreiro, 81), Kane.
Yellow cards: Upamecano (23), Laimer (43), Saliba (74), Merino (80).
The most brilliant show took place in Paris. PSG defeated Tottenham 5-3, and Vitinha became a true hero of the match - he scored a hat-trick, leading his team to an important victory. This game was rich not only in goals, but also in high-speed attacks.
PSG - Tottenham 5:3
Goals: Vitinha (45, 53, 76 pen) - Richarlison (35), Kolo Muani (50, 72).
PSG: Chevalier, Zaire-Emery, Marquinhos, Pacio, Mendes (Hernandez, 46'), Neves, Vitinha (Zabarnyi, 90+4'), Ruiz, Barcola (Lee Kang-in, 56'), Njantu (Ramouche, 79'), Kvaratskhelia (Dembele, 79').
Tottenham Hotspur: Vicario, Porro, Gray (Palinha, 76'), van de Ven, Romero, Spence (Udoji, 84'), Bentancur, Bergvall (Jerusalem, 76'), Sarr (Odober, 84'), Richarlison, Kolo Muani (Simons, 84').
Yellow card: Bergvall (45+2).
Red card: Hernandez (90+3).
Real Madrid faced Olympiacos in a difficult match in Athens. But tonight, one name spun around - Kylian Mbappé. He scored a poker, opening a dramatic 4-3 victory for his team.
Olympiacos - Real Madrid 3:4
Goals: Chiquinho (8), Torimiy (52), Al Kaabi (81) - Mbappe (22, 24, 29, 60).
Olympiacos: Solakis, Rodiney (Kostinha, 71'), Retsos, Pirola (Biancon, 62'), Ortega, Muzakitis, Garcia (Hezze, 46'), Podense (Strefezza, 71'), Chiquinho (Torimiy, 28'), Martins, Al Kaabi.
Real Madrid: Lunin, Trent, Asensio (Diaz, 73'), Carreras, Mendy, Chuameni, Guler (Bellingham, 61'), Valverde, Camavinga (Ceballos, 46'), Vinicius (Fran Garcia, 90'), Mbappé.
Yellow cards: Camavinga (23), Ortega (40), Guler (56).
Liverpool organized the biggest sensation of the round - in a bad way. In the match at Anfield, PSV won 4-1 and unexpectedly defeated the English club.
Liverpool - PSV 1:4
Goals: Soboslai (16) - Perisic (6, penalty), Til (56), Drioux (73, 90+1).
Liverpool: Mamardashvili, Soboslai, Konaté (Keza, 76'), van Dijk, Kerkez, Jones, Gravenbergh, McAllister, Salah, Ekitike (Isak, 61'), Gakpo.
PSV: Kovar, Dest, Schuten, Gasiorovski, Salah-Eddin, Saibari, Mauro Junior, Verman, Man (Bayraktarevich, 89), Perišić (Driuh, 69), Til (Pepi, 69).
Yellow card: van Dijk (17).
In the clash between Atletico Madrid and Inter Milan, the Madrid side won 2-1 thanks to a goal in the final minutes.
Atletico Madrid - Inter Milan 2:1
Goals: Alvarez (9), Gimenez (90+3) - Zielinski (54).
Atletico Madrid: Mousso, Molina (Gonzalez, 59), Jimenez, Hanko, Ruggieri (Syorlot, 68), Simeone, Barrios, Cardoso (Pubil, 59), Gallagher (Koke, 59), Baena (Grizmann, 68), Alvarez.
Inter Milan: Sommer, Akanji, Bissek, Bastoni, Carlos Augusto, Dimarco (Enrique, 79'), Barella, Zielinski (Sucic, 65'), Çalhanoğlu (Frattezi, 72'), Martinez (Espozito, 72'), Bonnie (Turam, 65').
Yellow cards: Dimarco (44).
Atalanta and Sporting finished their matches convincingly, defeating their opponents 3-0.
Eintracht Frankfurt - Atalanta 0:3
Goals: Lukman (60), Ederson (62), de Ketelare (65).
Eintracht Frankfurt: Setteter, Collins, Koch, Teate, Brown, Dahud (Skhiri, 69), Shaibi, Doan (Buta, 78), Götze (Batshuayi, 69), Knauff (Vai, 78), Burkardt (Bahaya, 59).
Atalanta - Karnezekki, Kossunu, Hin, Jimsiti (Kolashinas, 74), Bellanova, de Roon, Ederson (Musa, 69), Zappacosta (Zalewski, 69), de Ketelare, Lukman (Sulemana, 82), Skamakka (Krstovic, 69).
Sporting - Bruges 3:0
Goals: Quenda (24), Suarez (31), Trincao (70).
Sporting - Silva, Fresneda, Diomande, Inácio, Araujo (Reis, 86), Simoes (Morita, 63), Hjulmann, Katamo (Bloëpa, 76), Trincao, Quenda (Alisson, 76), Suarez (Ribeiro, 86)
Club Brugge: Yakers, Sike (Spiers, 81), Ordonez, Mechele, Zeiss (Romero, 81), Stankovic (Diahon, 74), Vanaken, Onidica, Forbes (Vetlesen, 74), Verman (Tresoldi, 65), Solis.
Yellow cards: Hjulmann (9), Onidica (20), Solis (68), Zeiss (75).
Thus, the 5th round was remembered for its drama, outstanding goals, and intense rivalry between strong teams. Now all attention is on the decisive 6th round.
